ModuleDescription:
This module covers algorithmic foundations of computation
and communication privacy. It provides a thorough
methodology for analysis of privacy against inference
attacks using techniques from statistics, probability theory,
and machine learning. Students will learn how to reason
quantitatively about privacy, and evaluate it using the
appropriate metrics. The module will help students to
design privacy-preserving mechanisms for a range of
systems from anonymous communication to data analytics.
After this module, students should be able to identify
privacy vulnerabilities in a system, design inference
attacks, and propose effective countermeasures in a
systematic manner.
Prerequisite: (ST1232 or ST2131 or ST2334) and CS3230 and CS2107
